title: Marine Le Pen's political future is at stake as her appeal trial opens
subhead: The far-right leader, convicted of embezzling public funds, is approaching a pivotal moment: The judges' decision will determine whether she can participate in the 2027 presidential election.

title: Venezuela's Delcy Rodriguez faces an obstacle-strewn path
Corsican nationalist's assassination spotlights criminials' grip on island
Farmers drive tractors into Paris to protest Mercosur trade deal
subhead: For the second time in less than a week, dozens of tractors rolled into central Paris as farmers rallied against an EU trade pact with South American countries.

title: 'The Islamic Republic of Iran is entering its final phase'
subhead: Hemmed in by domestic and external crises, the Islamic Republic of Iran is now finding itself with nowhere left to turn, analyzes Farid Vahid, the co-director of the Observatory of North Africa and the Middle East at the Fondation Jean Jaurès.

title: Paris launches project for Montparnasse renovation
subhead: The architect Renzo Piano unveiled his new renovation plan for the shopping center. Construction is hoped to start in 2028.

title: Being gay in Uganda, where the death penalty looms
subhead: Since Uganda's Parliament introduced the death penalty for 'aggravated homosexuality' in 2023, young homosexual people have been forced underground, with only brief moments of freedom, such as the Nyege Nyege electronic music festival.

title: France's emission cuts remain off track for climate goals
In Los Angeles, the specter of lingering pollution after major wildfires
Ex-Fed chiefs, lawmakers slam US probe into Jerome Powell
Taiwan announces 'general consensus' with US on trade deal
'What is happening with tariffs sums up Trumpism: Bombastic declarations, laborious implementation and unpredictable results'
Trump announces tariffs on Iran's trading partners as protest toll rises
Cuba's economy and stability are shaken by the Venezuela crisis
How France's fixation with decline serves the Trumpian narrative
'Anything can be considered a form of devotion. In my own way, I try to make the world a better place': Romain's conversion to the Bahá'í faith
NATO, Greenland vow to boost Arctic security after Trump threats
Paris FC's Ikoné stuns PSG, knocking out former club from French Cup
Morgue near Tehran overwhelmed by bodies amid protest crackdown
Exclusive images: On the set of 'Marty Supreme,' Timothée Chalamet dominates the game
subhead: In 'Marty Supreme,' directed by Josh Safdie, Timothée Chalamet plays Marty Mauser, a character inspired by the 1950s table tennis star Marty Reisman. With a Golden Globe win, the role cements the 30-year-old as one of the greatest actors of his generation. Photographer Tim El Kaïm had exclusive access to the set of this highly anticipated film, which is set for release in France in February.

title: The Ukrainian-held Donbas, a land of ruins and grief
subhead: This region in eastern Ukraine now has only 200,000 inhabitants, compared to five million before the Russian invasion of 2022. Le Monde visited the area still under Kyiv's authority.

title: Far right continues to gain ground in French public opinion
subhead: France is divided, with half the population anxious about the rise of the Rassemblement National, and half enthusiastic about the solutions it claims to offer, according to an annual survey conducted by the Verian institute for Le Monde.

title: 2027 French presidential election: A real campaign is needed to slow the far right
'For her appeals trial, Marine Le Pen has made the shrewd choice to fight differently'
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
